==Japanese==

===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|かみ|いち|だん|かつ|よう|yomi=y}}
A compound of {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|上一段|tr=kami ichidan||upper single grade}} and {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|活用|tr=katsuyō||conjugation}}. [[上二段活用|Upper bigrade]] verbs regularly become upper monograde. The "upper" notation refers to the -i stem which comes before the "lower" -e in Japanese order.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|かみ いちだん かつよう|acc=7|acc_ref=DJR|y=y}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かみ いちだん かつよう|hhira=かみいちだんくわつよう}}

# {{lb|ja|grammar|sort=しもいちだんかつよう}} upper monograde conjugation; a verbal conjugation class in which the verb stem ends in -i and the various inflections are -/-/ru/ru/re/[yo, ro]. Examples:
